text.text: Procompsognathus, a small coelophysid from Trassic Germany. The tiny coelophysid was discovered and described in 1906. It looks in many aspects as a larger Compsognathus, which came around in the Jurassic, but they are in no way related. The Procompsognathus is much less well known and researched than Compsognathus.
Procompsognathus was about one meter long, weighing 1 kilogram. It would've prayed upon small mammalian ancestors and small reptiles.
